td.p: An observation that represents a Body Surface Area measurement
An observation that represents the clinical TNM group score
An observation that represents the clinical 'M' score which measures metastases and spread.
An observation that represents the clinical 'N' score which measures local lymph node involvement.
An observation that represents the clinical 'T' score which measures the tumour size.
A CarePlan that represents a single cycle of treatment. It will have a 'partOf' reference to the regiment carePlan.

A CarePlan that represents a PlanDefinition being applied to a Patient. Referred to as a regimen. The regimen has multiple cycles also represented as CarePlans which have a 'partOf' reference back to the regimen plan.

The primary diagnosis for this cancer. Can have an evidence.detail reference to an Observation that has the histology and a stage.assessment reference to the TNM Observation staging (clinical and pathological)
An observation that represents a Creatinine Clearance measurement
An observation that represents an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) score.
An observation that represents an ER status
An observation that represents the Gleason score
An observation that represents a height measurement
An observation that represents a human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2) status
An observation that represents a histology finding
ACT-NOW medication administration. These are medications that were actually administered.
ACT-NOW medication request. These are prescriptions given to the patient.
An observation that represents the pathological TNM (pTNM) group score
An observation that represents the pathological 'M' score (pM) which measures distant metastases
An observation that represents the pathological 'N' score (pN) which measures local lymph node involvement.
An observation that represents the pathological 'T' score (pT) which measures tumour size
ACT-NOW patient
An observation that represents a progesterone receptor (PR) status
An observation that represents a weight measurement
